segment.source: Distribute offline apps (Windows 10)
segment.target: Distribute offline apps (Windows 10)

segment.source: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.
segment.target: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.

segment.source: Distribute offline apps
segment.target: Distribute offline apps

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.
segment.target: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.

segment.source: With offline licenses, organizations can download apps and their licenses to deploy within their network, or on devices that are not connected to the Internet.
segment.target: With offline licenses, organizations can download apps and their licenses to deploy within their network, or on devices that are not connected to the Internet.

segment.source: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the Windows Dev Center.
segment.target: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the Windows Dev Center.

segment.source: Only apps that are opted in to offline licensing will show that they are available for offline licensing in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Only apps that are opted in to offline licensing will show that they are available for offline licensing in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: This model means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.
segment.target: This model means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.

segment.source: Why offline-licensed apps?
segment.target: Why offline-licensed apps?

segment.source: Offline-licensed apps offer an alternative to online apps, and provide additional deployment options.
segment.target: Offline-licensed apps offer an alternative to online apps, and provide additional deployment options.

segment.source: Some reasons to use offline-licensed apps include:
segment.target: Some reasons to use offline-licensed apps include:

segment.source: You don't have access to Windows Store services - If your employees don't have access to the internet and Windows Store services, downloading offline-licensed apps and deploying them with imaging is an alternative to online-licensed apps.
segment.target: You don't have access to Windows Store services - If your employees don't have access to the internet and Windows Store services, downloading offline-licensed apps and deploying them with imaging is an alternative to online-licensed apps.

segment.source: You use imaging to manage devices in your organization - Offline-licensed apps can be added to images and deployed with Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM), or Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).
segment.target: You use imaging to manage devices in your organization - Offline-licensed apps can be added to images and deployed with Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM), or Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).

segment.source: Your employees do not have Azure Active Directory (AD) accounts - Azure AD accounts are required for employees that install apps assigned to them from Store for Business or that claim apps from a private store.
segment.target: Your employees do not have Azure Active Directory (AD) accounts - Azure AD accounts are required for employees that install apps assigned to them from Store for Business or that claim apps from a private store.

segment.source: Distribution options for offline-licensed apps
segment.target: Distribution options for offline-licensed apps

segment.source: You can't distribute offline-licensed apps directly from the Store for Business.
segment.target: You can't distribute offline-licensed apps directly from the Store for Business.

segment.source: Once you download the items for the offline-licensed app, you have three options for distributing the apps:
segment.target: Once you download the items for the offline-licensed app, you have three options for distributing the apps:

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management.
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management.

segment.source: DISM is a command-line tool that is used to mount and service Microsoft WindowsWindows images before deployment.
segment.target: DISM is a command-line tool that is used to mount and service Microsoft WindowsWindows images before deployment.

segment.source: You can also use DISM to install, uninstall, configure, and update Windows features, packages, drivers, and international settings in a .wim file or VHD using the DISM servicing commands.
segment.target: You can also use DISM to install, uninstall, configure, and update Windows features, packages, drivers, and international settings in a .wim file or VHD using the DISM servicing commands.

segment.source: DISM commands are used on offline images.
segment.target: DISM commands are used on offline images.

segment.source: For more information, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management.
segment.target: For more information, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management.

segment.source: Windows ICD.
segment.target: Windows ICD.

segment.source: ICD is GUI tool that you can use to create Windows provisioning answer files, and add third-party drivers, apps, or other assets to an answer file.
segment.target: ICD is GUI tool that you can use to create Windows provisioning answer files, and add third-party drivers, apps, or other assets to an answer file.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer.

segment.source: Management server.
segment.target: Management server.

segment.source: Download an offline-licensed app
segment.target: Download an offline-licensed app

segment.source: There are several items to download or create for offline-licensed apps.
segment.target: There are several items to download or create for offline-licensed apps.

segment.source: You'll need all of these items to distribute offline apps to your employees.
segment.target: You'll need all of these items to distribute offline apps to your employees.

segment.source: This section includes more info on each item, and tells you how to download an offline-licensed app.
segment.target: This section includes more info on each item, and tells you how to download an offline-licensed app.

segment.source: App metadata -- App metadata is required for distributing offline apps.
segment.target: App metadata -- App metadata is required for distributing offline apps.

segment.source: The metadata includes app details, links to icons, product id, localized product ids, and other items.
segment.target: The metadata includes app details, links to icons, product id, localized product ids, and other items.

segment.source: App package -- App packages are required for distributing offline apps.
segment.target: App package -- App packages are required for distributing offline apps.

segment.source: There are app packages for different combinations of app platform and device architecture.
segment.target: There are app packages for different combinations of app platform and device architecture.

segment.source: You'll need to know what device architectures you have in your organization to know if there are app packages to support your devices.
segment.target: You'll need to know what device architectures you have in your organization to know if there are app packages to support your devices.

segment.source: App license -- App licenses are required for distributing offline apps.
segment.target: App license -- App licenses are required for distributing offline apps.

segment.source: Use encoded licenses when you distribute offline-licensed apps using a management tool or ICD.
segment.target: Use encoded licenses when you distribute offline-licensed apps using a management tool or ICD.

segment.source: Use unencoded licenses when you distribute offline-licensed apps using DISM.
segment.target: Use unencoded licenses when you distribute offline-licensed apps using DISM.

segment.source: App frameworks -- App frameworks are required for distributing offline apps, but you might not need to download one.
segment.target: App frameworks -- App frameworks are required for distributing offline apps, but you might not need to download one.

segment.source: If you already have the required framework, you don't need to download another copy.
segment.target: If you already have the required framework, you don't need to download another copy.

segment.source: The Store for Business will select the app framework needed for the app platform and architecture that you selected.
segment.target: The Store for Business will select the app framework needed for the app platform and architecture that you selected.

segment.source: To download an offline-licensed app
segment.target: To download an offline-licensed app

segment.source: Sign in to the Store for Business
segment.target: Sign in to the Store for Business

segment.source: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.
segment.target: Click Manage, and then choose Inventory.

segment.source: Click Refine, and then choose Offline.
segment.target: Click Refine, and then choose Offline.

segment.source: Find the app you want to download, click the ellipses under Actions, and then choose Download for offline use.
segment.target: Find the app you want to download, click the ellipses under Actions, and then choose Download for offline use.

segment.source: To download app metadata: choose the language for the app metadata, and then click Download.
segment.target: To download app metadata: choose the language for the app metadata, and then click Download.

segment.source: Save the downloaded app metadata.
segment.target: Save the downloaded app metadata.

segment.source: To download app package for offline use: click to expand the package details information, choose the Platform and Architecture combination that you need for your organization, and then click Download.
segment.target: To download app package for offline use: click to expand the package details information, choose the Platform and Architecture combination that you need for your organization, and then click Download.

segment.source: Save the downloaded app package.
segment.target: Save the downloaded app package.

segment.source: To download an app license: choose either Encoded, or Unencoded, and then click Generate license.
segment.target: To download an app license: choose either Encoded, or Unencoded, and then click Generate license.

segment.source: Save the downloaded license.
segment.target: Save the downloaded license.

segment.source: To download an app framework: find the framework you need to support your app package, and click Download.
segment.target: To download an app framework: find the framework you need to support your app package, and click Download.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You need the framework to support your app package, but if you already have a copy, you don't need to download it again.
segment.target: You need the framework to support your app package, but if you already have a copy, you don't need to download it again.

segment.source: Frameworks are backward compatible.
segment.target: Frameworks are backward compatible.
